text: @aloha_mike_520  No, you don't have to judge all women for it. Gillette didn't do this either (about man). They showed toxic behaviours and at the same time the good ones (stand up forb a girl, stop a fight, teaching daughters to be strong), so your point is a huge nonsense. "My cats" won't love me, because I don't have any. I'm married actually. Seriously, you are incapable of telling the difference between "toxic Masculinity"(Catcalling, mansplaning, bullying) and true, awesome Masculinity (for  example, all those good behaviours which I mentioned earlier). And if you think, Catcalling is something respectfull, then, as a woman, I'm so happy I'm nowhere near you.
@lios.alfar you're so right. Have a great day

@aloha_mike_520 Are you serious? Catcalling is a man thing? This ad is exactly for you!  I am one of these pretty girls and I hate it! I'm not some dog you can whistle for, I'm a human being, I want respect as a human being. God, why people like you are still out there. What cats? Just because @queen_astro said that you totally mixed two issues that makes her end with bunch of cats? Mansplaning is real, I study "manly" field as well, and this is happening very often. Maybe I'll surprise you, women don't need men to be fulfilled, this is some medieval nonsense!

@queen_astro catcalling is just a mating call... Found everywhere in nature. Pretty women love the attention. The ugly ones are the ones who made it into a problem because they weren't getting the attention. Mansplaining is a made up thing by 4th wave feminists looking for something to complain about. Feminists are ruining the world for women by creating seperation leaving more and more women to not find their guy so they end up lonely, depressed, and feeding their cats. Everything good in your life was made possible at the hands of men but go ahead and keep following the seperatist agenda. Your cats will love you more for it.

@queen_astro you've been bamboozled. Should we judge all women then when one burns down boyfriend house, destroys property, fake rape accusations, leave baby in dumpster. I mean it's easy to say toxic about anything.

@queen_astro 
For example, I feel the males it shows looking at women in bikinis on tv is fine and shouldn’t have to change, the reason I feel this way is because there are plenty of females who like to look at them too!
Play fighting is fine! If it’s not real fighting, girls do this too. That’s just another stereotypical scene which was unnecessary.

The advert also made reference to how some men are already acting the way they should. So, rather than saying only some men are good, (Implying the majority are bad), they should say the opposite, only some men are bad (and acknowledge most are decent human beings) that is what has got people’s backs up the most.

Then they stereotyped men as being big dumb oafs stood behind barbecues, that’s not okay either.

A lot of feminists seem to think if we don’t like the advert then we are all for this bad behaviour, when actually we don’t like poor antics either but we dislike the way men have been portrayed and masculinity as a whole. Rather than just the negative behaviours which actually apply to both sexes.
@queen_astro I genuinely disagree. I feel those conversations are needed of course but I feel the advert is misandrist and unfair, to say the least.

@leanneyhunter No, the advert shows toxic behaviours and the good one at the same time. The biggest problem is that man usually don't see why catcalling or mansplaning is wrong. This ad showed it. Most of the time man(who are guilty of this) are unaware that what they are doing is wrong. That's the real problem. Noone said that they are bad people, just that they can do better. I study automatics and robotics, it's considered as a "manly" field, and those behaviours are way to common. When I say "stop doing that, stop whistle, stop being patriarchal" the answer is "What's wrong with it?". This is exactly why this ad is needed, it couldn't be clear from the begging because it would never gone viral. It's been few days and it already provoke so many needed conversation. It was outstanding marketing move.
@queen_astro I never said I stood for those things. I’ve never said that at all.

@queen_astro The advert tells us that that some men are good, meaning the majority are bad. It should have been the opposite way around. Some men are bad but the majority are good.
It could have been a great ad to get across an important message if it wasn’t put across in such a poor way.
It stereotypes men by having a line of them attending barbecues and generally gives the impression that being masculine is a bad thing. Kids playing wrestling or play fighting for example, they just went overboard.
If it were reversed and done like this about toxic femininity then there would be outrage. But because it’s men who have been pigeonholed then nobody is allowed to defend them.
I personally feel it is a disgusting and vile commercial and has wasted the opportunity to really get an important message across.
@leanneyhunter You need to stand for mansplaning, catcalling and bullying? Not nice. This ad shows toxic masculinity, not masculinity itself
Catcalling is wrong, mansplaning is wrong, toxic masculinity existing. Toxic masculinity is toxic. Not masculinity itself. When did you get lost in this ad?
I’ll be using @ws_women on my legs from now on. We need to stand by our men and #boycottgillette
